DataElement.preferredName: Reduced Absolute Neutrophil Count Post Transplant Assessment Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not a reduction in the absolute neutrophil count post transplant was assessed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Reduced Absolute Neutrophil Count Post Transplant Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a reduction, less than 500/mm^3, in the real number of white blood cells (WBCs) that are  neutrophils, derived by multiplying the WBC count times the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count, following treatment using healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from another person, donor, or another part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.:The real number of white blood cells (WBCs) that are
neutrophils. The ANC is derived by multiplying the WBC count times the
percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count; the percent of
neutrophils consists of the segmented (fully mature neutrophils) + the
bands (almost mature neutrophils). The normal range for the ANC is 1.5
to 8.0 (1,500 to 8,000/mm3).

Concepts.definition: Made less in size or amount or degree.

The real number of white blood cells (WBC) that are neutrophils. It is derived by multiplying the WBC count by the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count. The normal range for ANC is 1.5 to 8.0 (1,500 to 8,000/mm3).

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.
